intro: Ouratea pubescens, commonly known as the hairy ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers are followed by bright red, fleshy fruits that attract various bird species.
